page.title: 02Jersey Crops
page.content: {Agriculture}is the{third most {important industry}in Jersey after Tourism and Banking. Farms in Jersey are small and they grow a variety of crops. Jersey crops catch the English market because the island generally has warmer weather than England and the{crops are harvested earlier.} The most important crops that are ready for harvest earlier than English grown ones are{spring flowers}and {potatoes. Broccoli}grows quite well in the winter because the climate is mild. In Jersey there are quite a few greenhouses but many are disused nowadays because the Dutch can produce crops grown under glass much more cheaply than Jersey growers. New crops are being tried under glass such as{peppers, chillies}and{Kiwi fruit.
